name: Sound
comment: Sound class simplifies common tasks like audio inputs and visualizations using a subset of Web Audio API. It can be used with other audio libraries like tone.js, and extended to support additional web audio functions. See [the guide](../guide/Sound-0800.html) to get started.

signatures.comment: Construct a `Sound` instance. Usually, it's more convenient to use one of the static methods like [`Sound.load`](#function_load) or [`Sound.from`](#function_from).

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: a `SoundType` string: "file", "input", or "gen"

accessors.name: binSize
accessors.comment: If an analyzer is added (see [`analyze`](##unction_analyze) function), get the number of frequency bins in the analyzer.

accessors.name: buffer
accessors.comment: Get this Sound's AudioBuffer (if any) instance for advanced use-cases. See [`Sound.loadAsBuffer`](#link).

accessors.name: ctx
accessors.comment: Get this Sound's AudioContext instance for advanced use-cases.

accessors.name: frequency
accessors.comment: If the sound is generated, this sets and gets the frequency of the tone.

accessors.name: node
accessors.comment: Get this Sound's AudioNode subclass instance for advanced use-cases.

accessors.name: outputNode
accessors.comment: Get this Sound's Output node AudioNode instance for advanced use-cases.

accessors.name: playable
accessors.comment:
Indicate whether the sound is ready to play. When loading from a file, this corresponds to a ["canplaythrough"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/readyState) event.
You can also use `this.source.addEventListener( 'canplaythrough', ...)` if needed. See also [MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement/canplaythrough_event).

accessors.name: playing
accessors.comment: Indicate whether the sound is currently playing.

accessors.name: progress
accessors.comment: A value between 0 to 1 to indicate playback progress.

accessors.name: sampleRate
accessors.comment: Get the sample rate of the audio, for example, at 44100 hz.

accessors.name: source
accessors.comment: Get this Sound's Audio element (if used) instance for advanced use-cases. See [`Sound.load`](#link).

accessors.name: stream
accessors.comment: Get this Sound's MediaStream (eg, from microphone, if in use) instance for advanced use-cases. See [`Sound.input`](#link)

accessors.name: type
accessors.comment: Get the type of input for this Sound instance. Either "file", "input", or "gen"

signatures.comment: Add an analyzer to this `Sound`. Call this once only.

parameters.name: size
parameters.comment: the number of frequency bins

parameters.name: minDb
parameters.comment: Optional minimum decibels (corresponds to `AnalyserNode.minDecibels`)

parameters.name: maxDb
parameters.comment: Optional maximum decibels (corresponds to `AnalyserNode.maxDecibels`)

parameters.name: smooth
parameters.comment: Optional smoothing value (corresponds to `AnalyserNode.smoothingTimeConstant`)

signatures.comment: Connect another AudioNode to this `Sound` instance's AudioNode. Using this function, you can extend the capabilities of this `Sound` instance for advanced use cases such as filtering.

parameters.name: node
parameters.comment: another AudioNode

signatures.comment: Create or re-use an AudioBuffer. Only needed if you are using `Sound.loadAsBuffer`.

parameters.name: buf
parameters.comment: an AudioBuffer. Optionally, you can call this without parameters to re-use existing buffer.

signatures.comment: Get the raw frequency-domain data from analyzer as unsigned 8-bit integers. An analyzer must be added before calling this function (See [analyze](#function_analyze) function).
Map the frequency-domain data from analyzer to a range. An analyzer must be added before calling this function (See [analyze](#function_analyze) function).
signatures.returns_comment: a Group containing the mapped values

parameters.name: size
parameters.comment: map each data point `[index, value]` to `[width, height]`

parameters.name: position
parameters.comment: Optionally, set a starting `[x, y]` position. Default is `[0, 0]`

parameters.name: trim
parameters.comment: Optionally, trim the start and end values by `[startTrim, data.length-endTrim]`

signatures.comment:
Removes the 'output' node added from setOuputNode
Note: if you start the Sound after calling this, it will play via the default node
Stop playing and disconnect the AudioNode.

Sets the 'output' node for this Sound
This would typically be used after Sound.connect, if you are adding nodes
in your chain for filtering purposes.

parameters.name: outputNode
parameters.comment: The AudioNode that should connect to the AudioContext

signatures.comment: Start playing. Internally this connects the `AudioNode` to `AudioContext`'s destination.

parameters.name: timeAt
parameters.comment: optional parameter to play from a specific time

signatures.comment: Stop playing. Internally this also disconnects the `AudioNode` from `AudioContext`'s destination.
Get the raw time-domain data from analyzer as unsigned 8-bit integers. An analyzer must be added before calling this function (See [analyze](#function_analyze) function).
Map the time-domain data from analyzer to a range. An analyzer must be added before calling this function (See [analyze](#function_analyze) function).
signatures.returns_comment: a Group containing the mapped values

parameters.name: size
parameters.comment: map each data point `[index, value]` to `[width, height]`

parameters.name: position
parameters.comment: Optionally, set a starting `[x, y]` position. Default is `[0, 0]`

parameters.name: trim
parameters.comment: Optionally, trim the start and end values by `[startTrim, data.length-endTrim]`

signatures.comment: Toggle between `start` and `stop`. This won't work if using [`Sound.loadAsBuffer`](#link), since `AudioBuffer` can only be played once. (See [`Sound.createBuffer`](#link) to reset buffer for replay).

Create a `Sound` given an [AudioNode](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode) and an [AudioContext](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext) from Web Audio API. See also [this example](../guide/js/examples/tone.html) using tone.js in the [guide](../guide/Sound-0800.html).

parameters.name: node
parameters.comment: an AudioNode instance

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: an AudioContext instance

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: a string representing a type of input source: either "file", "input", or "gen".

parameters.name: stream
parameters.comment: Optionally include a MediaStream, if the type is "input"

signatures.comment: Create a `Sound` by generating a waveform using [OscillatorNode](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OscillatorNode).

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: a string representing the waveform type: "sine", "square", "sawtooth", "triangle", "custom"

parameters.name: val
parameters.comment: the frequency value in Hz to play, or a PeriodicWave instance if type is "custom".

signatures.comment: Create a `Sound` by streaming from an input device like microphone. Note that this function returns a Promise which resolves to a Sound instance.

parameters.name: constraint
parameters.comment: @param constraint Optional constraints which can be used to select a specific input device. For example, you may use [`enumerateDevices`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices/enumerateDevices) to find a specific deviceId;

signatures.comment: Create a `Sound` by loading from a sound file or an audio element.

parameters.name: source
parameters.comment: either an url string to load a sound file, or an audio element.

parameters.name: crossOrigin
parameters.comment: whether to support loading cross-origin. Default is "anonymous".

signatures.comment:
Create a `Sound` by loading from a sound file url as `AudioBufferSourceNode`. This method is cumbersome since it can only be played once.
Use this method for now if you need to visualize sound in Safari and iOS. Once Apple has full support for FFT with streaming `HTMLMediaElement`, this method will likely be deprecated.

parameters.name: url
parameters.comment: an url to the sound file
